alert.note: Alert for DeSoto (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 06 at 6:42PM CST until March 15 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Mississippi...Tennessee...Arkansas... Mississippi River at Memphis For the Lower Mississippi River...including Tiptonville, Caruthersville, Osceola, Memphis, Tunica Mhoon Landing, Helena... elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY, MARCH 15... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Memphis. * WHEN...Until Tuesday, March 15. * IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, In Memphis, the boat landing on the north end of Mud Island at the mouth of the Wolf River is covered. In Arkansas, recreational vehicle park south of West Memphis starts to flood. Dacus Lake Road is flooding north and south of I-40. The river is against the toe of the levee from the north Shelby County line south to near Sulcer Road. Water is encroaching the levee near the south end of Island 40 Chute. The camp near Mound City is flooding. Water is beginning to flood the settlement near Blue Lake. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM CST Sunday the stage was 30.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 10.4 feet Sunday, March 27. - Action stage is 28.0 feet. - Flood stage is 34.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
